findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to perform transactions when the trading is not open, allowing them to take advantage of it by performing transactions when the trading is closed.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the variable `swapThreshold` can be set to a big number, triggering a huge amount of token swaps, which may lead to significant price volatility due to the highly volatile token price.

findings.title: VO - Variables Optimization
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized by removing redundant variables `maxBuyFee` and `maxSellFee` which share the same information and are immutable.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions, but are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed after being set and decrease gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, including naming conventions for functions, variables, contracts, structs, enums, and constants. Adhering to these conventions can improve the readability and maintainability of the code.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured with user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
